title: EU to fire trade 'bazooka'? Macron urges tough action against Trump tariffs
content: France will ask the EU to activate its anti-coercion instrument against potential US tariffs over Greenland. President Macron stated the threat is unacceptable and Europe will not be intimidated. The tool, a trade 'bazooka,' allows the bloc to curb imports or market access in response to economic coercion.

title: J&K: 3 soldiers injured in encounter between security forces & terrorists in Kishtwar
content: Three soldiers were injured in a fierce encounter with suspected foreign terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district. The gunfight erupted during a search operation in the Sonnar area, with security forces engaging a group of two to three Jaish-e-Mohammad militants. Reinforcements have been deployed as a large-scale operation to track down the terrorists is underway.

title: Lens on Bezosâ€™ ex-wife over donations; millions may have gone to groups under FBI probe
content: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: Occult â€˜human sacrificeâ€™: 3 kill friend, burn body for â€˜divine blessingsâ€™ in Ghaziabad
content: Ghaziabad police arrested two men for allegedly murdering a friend as part of an occult ritual. The victim, Naveen, was killed and his body set ablaze inside an auto. The accused confessed to meeting a tantrik who suggested human sacrifice for wealth. They attacked Naveen with a gas cylinder. Evidence including the auto and cylinder were recovered.

title: IND vs NZ: Kohliâ€™s 124 in vain; NZ clinch first-ever bilateral series in India
content: India suffered a historic home series defeat to New Zealand as Virat Kohliâ€™s 124 off 108 balls went in vain in the third ODI at Holkar Stadium. Chasing 338, India was all out for 296. New Zealandâ€™s centuries from Daryl Mitchell (137) and Glenn Phillips (106) powered a 337-run total. Despite Kohli and Harshit Ranaâ€™s efforts, India fell short, handing New Zealand a 2-1 series win.

title: Virat Kohli rewrites ODI history: Surpasses Ponting with this record
content: Virat Kohli's magnificent 54th ODI century against New Zealand, a record seventh against the Kiwis, anchored India's chase. Despite a challenging target and early wickets, Kohli's resilient 124 off 108 balls, featuring crucial partnerships, kept hopes alive. His defiant knock underscored his class and ability to perform under pressure, even in defeat.

title: AI at work: Adoption outpaces employee training; majority feel unprepared for role changes
content: A report by Genius HRTech reveals a significant gap between AI adoption and corporate training, with 71% of professionals anticipating role changes due to AI. Despite widespread AI usage for efficiency, 61% of employees report inadequate organizational guidance, and only 37% have received proper training.

title: Noida techie's death: FIR lodged against two builders
content: A software engineer's tragic death in a water-filled pit after his car skidded off a Greater Noida road has led to an FIR against two developers.  The victim's family claims their pleas for safety measures at the accident-prone site were ignored.  Despite rescue efforts, dense fog hampered visibility, officials stated, as residents protested demanding justice and safety improvements.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI, emphasizing curiosity over credentials. He cautioned against abandoning fields like computer science due to automation fears, noting AI's capabilities extend beyond coding. Brin also highlighted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" who demonstrate proven skills, regardless of formal degrees.

title: Will Matthew Stafford play vs Bears tonight? Latest Rams injury update
content: Matthew Stafford is set to lead the Los Angeles Rams against the Chicago Bears despite a sprained index finger. Coach Sean McVay confirmed Stafford pushed through the injury and is ready to play. His playoff experience, recent All Pro season, and history versus Chicago remain central to the Ramsâ€™ divisional round plans.

title: Commodities watch: Gold likely to climb; silver may correct after record highs
content: Gold prices are poised to continue their upward trajectory, fueled by safe-haven demand and anticipated US Federal Reserve policy easing. Meanwhile, silver may experience a consolidation phase after a significant recent rally. Analysts are closely monitoring global economic data and geopolitical developments for further market direction.

title: Bill Belichick ESPN Role; UNC Post 4-8" (39 chars). Cuts fluff, retains facts
content: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPNâ€™s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolinaâ€™s head coach ended at 4â€“8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heelsâ€™ April 12 spring game.

title: Odunze questionable with foot injury for Bears-Rams
content: Chicago Bears' star receiver Rome Odunze is expected to play against the Los Angeles Rams despite a foot injury.  Having missed five games, Odunze returned last week and practiced fully Friday.  While his workload might be managed, his ability to stretch the field and win contested catches is crucial for the Bears' playoff hopes, even at less than full strength.

title: 'Terrible comments': Veteran domestic cricketer lambasts India coach
content: Former cricketer Priyank Panchal slammed assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate's remarks on Rohit Sharma and Nitish Kumar Reddy, questioning foreign coaches' grasp of Indian cricket dynamics. Panchal argued that a lack of cultural understanding and respect, especially from coaches with less impressive backgrounds, leads to such missteps, sparking debate on communication and sensitivity within the team.

title: Greenland row: Trump rattles EU with tariff threats - why India should take note for US trade deal
content: Trumpâ€™s move to impose tariffs on European allies over Greenland underscores how trade measures can be wielded as political tools, regardless of partnerships or agreements. For India, the message is clear: trade deals cannot substitute for strategic autonomy, which must remain non-negotiable.

title: 'Bengal ready to topple TMC's maha jungle raj': PM Modi rips into Mamata govt; watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a rally in Singur, West Bengal, urged voters to end the 15-year "mega-jungleraj" of the Mamata Banerjee government. He launched development projects worth over Rs 830 crore and flagged off three Amrit Bharat trains. Modi accused the state government of obstructing central schemes and highlighted West Bengal's potential for development.

title: 'Does he still have the fire?' Rohit's ODI future questioned after flop series
content: Rohit Sharma's recent ODI form has sparked debate about his motivation for the 2027 World Cup. Despite a strong prior run, a lean series against New Zealand has led commentators like Simon Doull and Ravi Shastri to question his hunger. The fragmented ODI calendar is also cited as a potential factor impacting rhythm and desire for the veteran opener.

title: Massive blaze at Karachi mall: Firefighter among six killed, many feared trapped - video
content: A massive fire ripped through Karachi's Gul Plaza shopping mall late Saturday, killing at least six people, including a firefighter. Rescue operations continued into Sunday as many were feared trapped inside the complex, which suffered severe structural damage. The blaze, suspected to be caused by a short circuit, has reignited concerns over fire safety standards in the city.

title: WEF 2026: Team India pitches â€˜partner with Bharatâ€™ message; AI and investment in focus
content: Team India is making a strong pitch at Davos, urging global partners to "subscribe to the future" by investing in Bharat and collaborating on technology.  The India Pavilion highlights investment opportunities, with IT majors showcasing AI advancements. Over 100 Indian CEOs and several state delegations are present, promoting India's economic potential to over 3,000 global leaders.

title: 'Beautiful woman distracts ... ': Congress MLA â€˜rapeâ€™ theory remark sparks row
content: Congress MLA Phool Singh Baraiya sparked outrage with remarks suggesting rape can follow seeing a beautiful woman and that SC/ST/OBC women are raped due to scriptural interpretations. Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav demanded an apology from Rahul Gandhi, while the Congress distanced itself, calling Baraiya's views personal.

title: â€˜Cautious approachâ€™: After marker row, SEC to revert to bottled indelible ink
content: Following controversy over erasable marker pens in recent municipal polls, the State Election Commission will revert to traditional bottled indelible ink for upcoming local body elections. This cautious approach aims to prevent bogus voting after viral videos showed ink marks being easily removed, sparking widespread criticism and demands for action.

title: IND vs NZ: Kiwi batter Daryl Mitchell equals Babar; closes in on Kohli's record
content: Daryl Mitchell reached another milestone during the third ODI against India, equalling Babar Azam and Pathum Nissanka for the most 50-plus ODI scores since 2023, with only Virat Kohli ahead. Walking in at 5 for 2, Mitchell played a calm 45 off 50 balls, rebuilding New Zealandâ€™s innings after early losses and guiding them past 90 with controlled batting.

title: Who is Nickolay Mladenov? Man at center of Gaza 'board of peace'
content: Nickolay Mladenov, a Bulgarian diplomat and former UN envoy, has been named High Representative for Gaza. He will work to turn a fragile US-backed ceasefire into lasting peace, linking the US, Israel, and Palestinian authorities.

title: MP: Speeding car mows down labourers; 2 killed, 11 hurt in Jabalpur
content: A speeding, unplated car mowed down labourers during their lunch break, killing two and injuring eleven in Jabalpur on Sunaday. The victims, from Mandla district, were installing road dividers when the horrific incident occurred near Ekta Chowk. Authorities are actively searching for the driver who fled the scene, with one injured person in critical condition.

title: 'Why are Americans paying?' Trump aide Navarro targets India again; AI in crosshair
content: Donald Trump's trade adviser Peter Navarro has criticized India, questioning why Americans pay for AI services hosted in the US but used by Indian users. This comes amid ongoing trade tensions, including US tariffs on Indian imports and Navarro's past criticisms of India's Russian oil purchases and trade practices.

title: Daryl Mitchell scripts history; makes this record
content: Daryl Mitchell proved a challenge for India in ODIs. His century helped New Zealand post 338. Mitchell's record against India is impressive. He leads in average runs against them. New Zealand's innings saw Mitchell and Glenn Phillips score centuries. This partnership was crucial. India's bowlers took wickets late in the innings. New Zealand finished at 337 for 8.

title: Budget 2026: MAIT seeks customs duty cuts on key electronic components
content: The IT industry body MAIT has urged the government to slash basic customs duty on key electronic components and boost tax incentives in the upcoming Union Budget. This move aims to strengthen domestic manufacturing, improve global competitiveness, and address supply chain vulnerabilities amid rising global uncertainties. MAIT also called for continued support for mobile manufacturing.

title: Amrit Bharat Express expands: PM Modi flags off 5 trains in Assam, Bengal - check details
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be inaugrating five new Amrit Bharat Express trains, expanding India's long-distance rail network. These new services aim to enhance travel experience and connectivity for the common man, with key routes connecting various regions including the North-East, North India, and South India.

title: Riding cycles of over Rs 10 lakh, India braces for historic chapter with Pune Grand Tour 2026
content: India enters a new era in professional cycling with the inaugural Pune Grand Tour, the countryâ€™s first UCI 2.2 multi-stage road race. Featuring 171 riders from 35 countries, it is scheduled from January 19 to 23. The five-day event puts India on the global professional cycling map.

title: â€˜He was screaming for helpâ€™: Techie drowns as car falls into pit in Noida; hereâ€™s what happened
content: In a heartbreaking incident, a software developer lost his life when his SUV plunged into a flooded construction pit in Noida. After crashing through a compromised wall, he desperately attempted to remain on the vehicle's roof, calling for help. However, thick fog obscured visibility, and the delayed response of rescue teams resulted in tragic consequences.

title: Smith reveals truth behind Babar Azam 'tantrum' claims as BBL drama erupts
content: Steve Smith has dismissed reports of a rift with teammate Babar Azam, clarifying a on-field decision during their Big Bash League match. Smith explained his tactical choice to prioritize a strong Power Surge over a single, which led to his explosive century.  The pair were later seen chatting casually, with Smith confirming their good relationship.

title: Govinda finally addresses speculation about his marriage to Sunita Ahuja
content: Govinda breaks silence on marriage split rumours with Sunita Ahuja, alleging a "big conspiracy" manipulates family. He calls silence "weakness," prays for no misunderstandings, and notes career struggles since 1987 marriage. Kids Tina (2015 debut) and Yashvardhan prep for films.

title: Hotel politics returns to Mumbai: Mahayutiâ€™s musical chairs over mayor after BMC win
content: The BJP, which emerged as the single largest party with 89 seats in the 227-member House, still falls short of electing a mayor on its own and depends on the Shinde-led Shiv Sena to cross the halfway mark of 114. Together, the allies command 118 seats, but the question of who controls the mayorâ€™s chair, and for how long, remains unresolved.

title: One bar of signal, miles from home: Indian students stranded in Iran; curfew hinders communication
content: Indian students in Iran, particularly near the Iraq border, struggled with internet shutdowns and curfews, relying on sporadic signals to contact anxious families. While some returned due to uncertainty, others remain, reporting campus safety despite the unrest. The situation highlights communication challenges and parental concerns

title: What's wrong with Labubu? Workers at Chinese factory exploited; long work & low pay
content: A report by China Labor Watch revealed exploitative practices at a factory producing popular Labubus dolls for Pop Mart. The factory allegedly hired underage workers without proper protections and forced employees to sign blank contracts. Workers also faced unrealistic production targets and excessive overtime, exceeding legal limits significantly.

title: Refs during Bills-Broncos called that?! What the NFL rulebook says and our analysis
content: When is a catch a catch and how much contact draws a penalty flag were in dispute Saturday in Denver.

title: Broncos' Nix breaks bone in ankle, out for playoffs
content: Broncos quarterback Bo Nix will miss the remainder of the playoffs after breaking a bone in his right ankle during overtime of Saturday's 33-30 win over the Bills, coach Sean Payton said.

title: Sources: Steelers open to Rodgers' return in '26
content: The Steelers remain open to an Aaron Rodgers reunion in 2026, even though it's unlikely because of Mike Tomlin's resignation, sources told ESPN.

title: Bills' McDermott rips refs' ruling on pivotal INT
content: Bills coach Sean McDermott wasn't happy with the way officials handled a critical overtime play that resulted in a Broncos interception Saturday, saying it was "too big of a play" not to stop the game and review it.

title: Cristobal bemoans targeting call on Canes' Lucas
content: Miami coach Mario Cristobal says the punishment that goes with a targeting call made in the second half needs to be reevaluated.

title: Source: Al-Shaair fined over eye black message
content: Texans linebacker Azeez Al-Shaair has been fined $11,593 for wearing eye black that contained the message "stop the genocide" during last week's wild-card game, a source told ESPN.

title: Seahawks showcase full arsenal, blow out 49ers
content: The Seahawks delivered an all-three-phases beatdown of the 49ers, racing to a 17-0 lead and never looking back in a 41-6 win to advance to the NFC title game.

title: Falcons hire Stefanski in Ryan's 1st move as prez
content: The Falcons hired Kevin Stefanski on Saturday after the former Browns coach and two-time NFL Coach of the Year had his second interview with the team earlier in the day.

title: Venus makes Aussie Open history, falters in loss
content: Venus Williams became the oldest player to compete in singles at the Australian Open but faltered late in a three-set loss to Olga Danilovic.

content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 26 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

content: The Broncos advanced to the AFC title game but lost their QB to a broken ankle. So what's next for them on their Super Bowl quest?

title: All-Pro LBs to coaches: How Texans' Ryans, Patriots' Vrabel have revived former teams
content: Mike Vrabel and DeMeco Ryans both turned around franchises in one year. On Sunday, they face off with a trip to the AFC title game on the line.

content: Kevin Stefanski didn't have a great record in Cleveland, but he'll have more talent to work with in Atlanta.

content: The 63-year-old has been able to call his own shot in this coaching search and wound up choosing the Giants.

content: Ben Johnson helped build one of the most explosive offenses in the NFL in Chicago. Here's how he did it.

title: Jaxon Smith-Njigba tops best arrival looks ahead of divisional round of the NFL playoffs
content: Before the divisional round got underway, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: The man, the meme, the legend: Curt Cignetti's rise to viral fame
content: Curt Cignetti has lots to be happy about, but you wouldn't know it by looking at him. His players and assistants break down their favorite Cignetti memes and faces.

title: Meet 'the special 13': The JMU transfers forming an unlikely Indiana CFP title core
content: Thirteen Dukes players followed Curt Cignetti to become Hoosiers. Those who remain are on the verge of CFB history.

title: Man United deliver huge blow to Man City title hopes with shock derby win
content: Manchester City's title bid is as good as over after Manchester United won the midfield battle at Old Trafford.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Inter defender Bastoni
content: Liverpool are looking to bolster their defensive options by signing Inter Milan's Alessandro Bastoni. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Men's: Duke is a 1-seed again
content: Is the ACC back? Eight single-digit seeds -- including one on the top line -- and a couple of bubble teams would suggest so.

title: Women's: South Carolina ascends to No. 2 overall
content: Texas, which fell at South Carolina on Thursday, tumbles to the final No. 1 seed after its second straight loss.

title: How Mike Tomlin spent his final day as the Steelers head coach
content: 'It was dead silent' when the coach stunned the Steelers' locker room. Here's what we know about what's next.

title: Giannis and the Bucks: Four possible pathways forward in Milwaukee at the deadline
content: The Bucks and Antetokounmpo currently sit in 11th place ahead of the trade deadline. What are their options?

title: Will Fernando Mendoza be the next Heisman-winning QB to fall victim to the national championship curse?
content: Since 1988, seven quarterbacks who have won the Heisman Trophy and earned a title game berth have fallen in the national championship game. Is Mendoza next?

title: 16 Stolen SUVs Recovered: How Delhi Police Busted High-End Car Theft Ring
content: Delhi Police has dismantled an inter-state motor vehicle theft syndicate with the arrest of three alleged members and recovery of 16 high-end stolen vehicles, an official said on Sunday.

title: 1 Killed, 27 Injured During Bull Race At Pongal Festival In Tamil Nadu
content: An elderly man lost his life, and at least 27 others sustained injuries during a bull race organised as part of Pongal festival celebrations at Govinda Reddipalayam village in Vellore district of Tamil Nadu on Sunday.

title: 6 Dead, 38 Missing After Fire Breaks Out At Shopping Complex In Pakistan: Report
content: At least six people were killed, and 38 others are missing after a massive fire broke out at Gul Plaza Shopping Mall in Karachi, which led to the back part of the complex collapsing, ARY News reported on Sunday.

title: "Time Will Answer": DK Shivakumar On Meeting With Congress High Command
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar on Sunday refrained from discussing his meeting with the Congress high command in New Delhi.

title: 7 Dead, 80 Injured After Bus Carrying Wedding Guests Overturns In Jharkhand
content: At least five people, including four women, were killed and 25 others injured after a bus carrying wedding guests overturned in Jharkhand's Latehar district on Sunday, police said.

title: Pakistan Says Trump Asked PM Shehbaz Sharif to Join Gaza 'Board of Peace'
content: Pakistan on Sunday said that Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has been invited by President Donald Trump to join the Board of Peace for Gaza.

title: Tamil Nadu Announces New State Award For Non-Hindi Language Writers
content: Chief Minister MK Stalin on Sunday announced an annual literary award for best works in languages including Tamil, Telugu, Bengali and Marathi.

title: UAE President Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan To Visit India On January 19
content: At the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, President of the United Arab Emirates, will pay an official visit to India on January 19, a statement by the Ministry of External Affairs said.

title: Trump Invites India To Be Part Of Gaza's "Board Of Peace", Say Sources
content: US President Donald Trump has invited India to be a part of what he called "Board of Peace" meant to oversee governance and reconstruction in postwar Gaza, sources told NDTV.

title: Bhopal Man Caught By Woman's Family Forced To Drink Urine, Thrashed
content: A chilling case of extreme brutality against a young man from Bhopal has surfaced from Rajasthan, exposing a disturbing mix of vigilante violence, humiliation, and lawlessness.

title: 7 Soldiers Injured During Gunbattle With Terrorists In J&K
content: Seven soldiers were injured while engaging terrorists holed up in harsh terrain in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar, sources have said.

title: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy Enrolls For 5-Day Global Leadership Course At Harvard
content: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy has enrolled in a global leadership programme at Harvard University in the United States.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Is Vijay's TVK Reacting Like A Fan Club Or A Political Party?
content: The conspicuous silence of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) over the Jana Nayagan controversy has triggered uneasy questions in Tamil Nadu's political circles. Is Vijay's party behaving like an extension of his fan club.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar's Rare Appearance For Son-In-Law's Book Release At Jaipur Literature Festival
content: Former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar made a rare public appearance at the Jaipur Literature Festival today for the release of his son-in-law Kartikeya Vajpayee's debut novel, 'The Unbecoming'.

title: 12 Detained In UP For Offering Namaz In Empty House 'Without Permission'
content: Police have detained 12 people in a village in Bareilly district for allegedly offering namaz at a empty house "without permission", officials said on Sunday.

title: Devendra Fadnavis Represents 'Magnetic Maharashtra' At World Economic Forum
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis arrived in Davos ahead of the World Economic Forum (WEF) and praised the Indians for their cultural connect through Lezim performance and the representation of Wari tradition.

title: Partner With Bharat, Subscribe To Future: India's Pitch At Davos Summit
content: From a new address here, once occupied by the iconic Piano Bar, Team India has a clear message written all over the snow-laden alleys of this ski resort town, Partner with Bharat and subscribe to the future.

title: 2 Dead, 11 Injured After Speeding Car Rams Labourers In Jabalpur
content: Two persons died and 11 were injured after a speeding car rammed into 13 labourers in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Sunday, a senior police official said.

title: From Meloni To Erdogan: Who Has Been Invited To Be On Trump's Gaza Boards?
content: US President Donald Trump's administration has reached out to various figures around the world to sit on a so-called "Board of Peace" and related entities meant to oversee governance and reconstruction in postwar Gaza.

title: 'Rs 3,000 Per Plot, Papers Taken': Manipur's Displaced Tribals Seek Answers From Civil Group ITLF
content: Members of tribal communities who left Manipur's capital Imphal after Meitei-Kuki ethnic violence broke out in May 2023 have asked a civil society organisation of the Kuki tribes to give details of money and documents it has taken from them.

title: Indian-origin Keshav Poddar to serve as Jersey City deputy mayor; takes oath on Bhagwat Gita
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. content: New Delhi has not yet responded to the invitation, sources say; the Board of Peace is a key part of the U.S. Presidentâ€™s peace plan for Gaza, intended to supervise a transitional governance committee of experts

title: Anna University partners withÂ  the Andhra Pradesh government to develop drone ambulance
content: The project will ensure rapid medical response in remote and underserved regions and strengthen public health infrastructure. This is one of the key projects envisioned by Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to modernise emergency healthcare and human transport systems

content: In crucial poll year, Hindu social organisations representing Nair, Ezhava interests bury the hatchet on their long-standing differences on reservations

content: They say its unconstitutional for a CM to give such call, they want DGP to take action against efforts to disturb L&O; warn of retaliation

title: Kochi City police register 111 NDPS cases in three weeks
content: 31 NDPS cases registered on January 17 alone during a day-long special combing operation across the city. Police say all cases detected during the drive relate to alleged substance use

content: Revised palliative care guidelines enhance local services, ensuring comprehensive support for all income groups in Keralaâ€™s communities.

content: The thaw in relations, which has been gradually taking shape since the Global Ayyappa Sangamam in September last year, spills into the public domain, driven by their shared opposition to Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan

title: NDRF 10th Battalion to celebrate Raising Day on January 19
content: The force saved 67 persons in major operations and evacuated 1,634 people in 2025, winning laurels from one and all, says Commandant Prasanna Kumar

content: YSR Congress Party leader alleges that the Chief Minister invokes NTRâ€™s name to deflect criticism, cites the unfulfilled 2014 statue promise and demands a Bharat Ratna and policy reversals to prove sincerity

title: Automated toll issues trigger jams on partially opened Bengaluruâ€“Chennai Expressway
content: The expressway, envisioned to cut travel time between Bengaluru and Chennai to under three hours, is still under construction. Of the total 262-km length, around 71 km has been completed so far.

content: CPI(M) general secretary says Pinarayi Vijayan will lead LDFâ€™s poll campaign, but says Polit Bureau is yet to take a call on relaxing term limits

content: This comes against the backdrop of reports that a few children from Malappuram and Kozhikode were hospitalised after exhibiting adverse reactions following the vaccination

content: Though National Highway development is progressing rapidly, the construction of a newly built underpass near the Nadal railway gate has emerged as a major bottleneck

content: The hospital is being equipped with a modern organ transplantation centre and advanced operation theatres capable of supporting all types of transplant surgeries

content: Traffic jams were seen on several locations, including Singaperumal Koil, Madurantakam, and Tambaram. Chengalpattu townâ€™s interior roads were busier than usual due to motorists taking detours to reach OMR and ECR

content: Children no longer receive eggs, sathumavu (fortified nutrition mix), and cooked meals; their parents, mostly daily wage earners, are struggling to provide them nutritious food

content: Naidu pays tributes to TDP founder N.T. Rama Rao on the occasion of his 30th death anniversary, says the former CM had defined â€˜good governanceâ€™ and prioritised development while implementing welfare schemes, which set a benchmark back then

title: State-level distribution of sustainable hygiene products to begin on January 20
content: Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal will launch a State-wide initiative to distribute 1.69 lakh menstrual cups and incinerators in select institutions.

content: SC issues series of directions, including that vacant faculty positions in both public and private higher education institutions (HEIs) must be filled up within four months; appointments of Vice-Chancellors and Registrars must be made within a month of the posts falling vacant, it says

content: Veteran CPI(M) leader says the party follows a distinct ideology that is not impacted by individuals leaving it

title: Majority of incumbent MLAs in Kozhikode may get another chance
content: There are 13 Assembly constituencies in the district and the Left Democratic Front has 11 representatives. The others belong to the Indian Union Muslim League and the Revolutionary Marxist Party

title: Poor adherence to pet ownership norms raises public safety concerns
content: Animal welfare activists and rescuers say weak implementation and unchecked pet abandonment continue to worsen public safety and animal health concerns in both urban and rural areas

title: BJP is peopleâ€™s first choice, Congress has lost the nationâ€™s trust: PM
content: PM cites poll results for Bihar Assembly, Mumbai local body, and Thiruvananthapuram mayor to claim a national trend; accuses Congress of handing over Assam land to infiltrators, neglecting Kaziranga National Park

title: One more tiger cub captured in Nanjidevanapura in Chamarajanagar
content: With the tigress and two cubs already captured, the operation to capture the remaining two tiger cubs is under way

title: Jaganâ€™s faction politics haunting Palnadu, alleges Energy Minister
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar claims that during its five-year rule, the YSRCP completely devastated the Palnadu region, and now, as the State moves forward on the path of development, they are unable to tolerate the progress

title: 1 dead, 24 injured in vehicle pile-up in Uttar Pradesh amid dense fog
content: A state roadways bus travelling from Gorakhpur to Meerut hit a truck, following which several vehicles coming from behind crashed into one another due to poor visibility, said SHO of Faridpur Police station Radheshyam

title: 'Truth of India': Mufti responds to Rahman's 'communal' remark; shares 'realities of Indian Muslims'
content: NEW DELHI: The former chief minister of Jammu and Kashmir, Mehbooba Mufti, responded to AR Rahman's "communal" remark, stating that it is the "truth of India." Music composer AR Rahman, in a BBC Asian Network interview, had stated that he has been getting less work in the industry, and he feels it is a "communal thing. " In a post on X, Mehbooba Mufti wrote, "Bollywood has always been a living mini India, mirroring the countryâ€™s social realities. Brushing aside such experiences does not change the truth about todayâ€™s India."

title: NEET aspirant death case: Bihar deputy CM orders swift action; family alleges cover-up
content:
Bihar deputy CM vows strict action in NEET aspirant death case

NEW DELHI: Bihar deputy chief minister Samrat Choudhary has ensured a swift investigation into the death case of a NEET aspirant in Jehanabad. He ensured that the police had constituted a special investigation team and that the ones involved in the death of the female student would not be spared. Talking to the reporters, Choudhary said, "Police have already constituted a special investigation team to probe the incident. The DGP himself is monitoring the investigation. Those involved in her death will not be spared."

title: 10 NBA teams that could swing trade season's final 20 days
content: the league's three-week sprint to the Feb. 5 trade deadline is here . many contenders are still deciding on a direction . a weekly trip around the Association focuses on those teams trying to add to their rosters .

title: Carson Beck the runner? The Miami QB is finally using his feet
content: Carson Beck hasn't run a 40-yard dash in years, but it hardly qualifies him as slow . he showcased his wheels on a 3-yard scramble into the end zone to secure a trip to the college football playoff national championship . safety Jakobe Thomas appeared to be the originator, dubbing Beck as the Miami's version of Michael Vick .

title: How will latest moves rock the NL East?
content: the nleast east's offseason activity hasn't happened in new york . the national league east is experiencing a dizzying winter with major upheaval . each team has an urgency rating based on how much each still needs to accomplish .

title: VAR review: Should Man United's Dalot have received a red card for foul on Doku?
content: Mikel Arteta questions the decision not to award a late penalty in their goalless draw with Nottingham Forest . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the premier league . we take a look at the major incidents to examine and explain the process .

title: How Davante Adams broke through in L.A. after failing to do so with Raiders, Jets
content: davante Adams signed a two-year, $44 million contract in march . he has a $28 million cap number in 2026 . the Rams head coach's message was clear . it didn't take long for Adams to realize that playing for him was where he needed to be .

title: Can Miami become the latest team to lift the national title on 'home' field?
content: this year marks the ninth national championship of the BCS and playoff eras . a team playing a national championship game at its home stadium is unprecedented in FBS history . one of the competing squads will be from the same state as the title .
